definitions.definition: The ability of a system or living organism to adjust its internal environment to maintain a state of dynamic constancy; such as the ability of warm-blooded animals to maintain a stable temperature .
Such a dynamic equilibrium or balance.

main_definition: ( physiology ) The ability of a system or living organism to adjust its internal environment to maintain a state of dynamic constancy; such as the ability of warm-blooded animals to maintain a stable temperature .
secondary_definitions: Such a dynamic equilibrium or balance.
